The Value of Firm Networks: A Natural Experiment on Board Connections (June 2021)

joint with Ester Faia and Vincenzo Pezone

We present causal evidence on the effect of boardroom networks on firm value and compensation policies. We exploit a ban on interlocking directorates of Italian financial and insurance companies as exogenous variation and show that firms that lose centrality in the network experience negative abnormal returns around the announcement date. The key driver of our results is the role of boardroom connections in reducing asymmetric information. The complementarities with the input-output and cross-ownership networks are consistent with this channel. Using hand-collected data, we also show that network centrality has a positive effect on directorsâ€™ compensation, providing evidence of rent sharing.
